page.title: 06Housing
page.content: The oldest houses are the stone cottages clustered around Cheddleton Church, many now converted from two cottages into one modern home dating from 1500 onwards. The largest house is Ashcombe Park, built in the Georgian style. The coming of the canal encouraged the building of rows of cottages near the flint mill, and at the Bottom of Basford Bridge lane, for railway workers at Lekbrook and Wall Grange, also the avenue by Brittains Ltd. This century, large residential houses have been built at Cheddleton Heath and along the Southern road out of Cheddleton. Before and after the 2nd World War, council houses were built near the hospital, Leekbrook,and along the Avenue. In the last 20 years,three large estates of modern houses have been built.
